body:
Comment 2 by **david@bitinvert.com**: 
Marshaler appears to be in some dictionaries but not all.
The consensus in IRC was that correct English words are preferred.

Reading through the output of
find ./go/src/pkg -type f -name "*.go" | xargs egrep '^type.*(er|or) interface {'
shows that an applicable agent noun tends to be used instead of strictly verb+"er", when
an agent noun exists.

Examples for:
Visitor   (vs. Visiter)
Formatter (vs. Formater)
Scanner   (vs. Scaner)
CloseNotifier (vs. CloseNotifyer)

Examples against:
Queryer (vs. Querier, though like Marshaler, this isn't in all dictionaries, either)


It would be best to make the specifics (or lack of specifics) of the convention clear,
regardless of what they are.
The current ambiguity is unsettling because it's another nit to waste time on.
